Package com.safetynet.alerts.controller

Class FirestationController

java.lang.Object
com.safetynet.alerts.controller.FirestationController
@RestController public class FirestationController extends Object
A class that receives requests made from the usual CRUD endpoints for the firestations.
Version:
1.0
Author:
SÃ©bastien Cappon

    org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Firestation>
    addFirestation(Firestation firestation)
    A PostMapping method on the /firestation URI which calls the eponymous IFirestationService method and returns the Firestation added with status code 201.

  • Constructor Details

    • FirestationController

      public FirestationController()

  • Method Details

    • getFirestationsList

      @GetMapping("/firestations") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<Firestation>> getFirestationsList()
      A GetMapping method on the /firestations URI which calls the eponymous IFirestationService method and returns the list of all firestations mapping with status code 200. If the result is empty, it returns status code 204.
      Returns:
      Firestation list and a status code.

    • getFirestationsByAddress

      @GetMapping("/firestation/{address}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<Firestation>> getFirestationsByAddress(@PathVariable("address") String stationAddress)
      A GetMapping method on the /firestation URI with an address as PathVariable. It calls the eponymous IFirestationService method and returns the list of firestations mapping for this address, with status code 200. If the result is empty, it returns status code 204.
      Returns:
      Firestation list and a status code.

    • addFirestation

      @PostMapping("/firestation") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Firestation> addFirestation(@RequestBody Firestation firestation) throws Exception
      A PostMapping method on the /firestation URI which calls the eponymous IFirestationService method and returns the Firestation added with status code 201. If the result is null, it returns status code 204.
      Returns:
      Firestation list and a status code.
      Throws:
      BAD_REQUEST - if station and address are null or blank in the request body.
      Exception

    • updateFirestationNumber

      @PutMapping("/firestation/{station}-{address}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<Firestation>> updateFirestationNumber(@PathVariable("station") Long stationNumber, @PathVariable("address") String stationAddress, @RequestBody Long newStationNumber)
      A PutMapping method on the /firestation URI with a station number and an address as PathVariables. It calls the eponymous IFirestationService method and returns the Firestation mapping list modified, with status code 200. If the result is null, it returns status code 204.
      Returns:
      Firestation list and a status code.

    • deleteFirestation

      @DeleteMapping("/firestation/{station}-{address}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Void> deleteFirestation(@PathVariable("station") Long stationNumber, @PathVariable("address") String stationAddress)
      A DeleteMapping method on the /firestation URI with a station number and an address as PathVariables. It calls the eponymous IFirestationService method and returns nothing except status code 204.
      Returns:
      a status code 204.
